intro: Benzingia cornuta, commonly known as the horned benzingia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like projections on its leaves, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green, and bloom in the spring. Benzingia cornuta is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley.
